19namespace ZXing {
20
21class ByteArray;
22
23/**
24* <p>This provides an easy abstraction to read bits at a time from a sequence of bytes, where the
25* number of bits read is not often a multiple of 8.</p>
26*
27* <p>This class is thread-safe but not reentrant -- unless the caller modifies the bytes array
28* it passed in, in which case all bets are off.</p>
29*
30* @author Sean Owen
31*/
32class BitSource
33{
34 const ByteArray& _bytes;
35 int _byteOffset = 0;
36 int _bitOffset = 0;
37
38public:
39 /**
40 * @param bytes bytes from which this will read bits. Bits will be read from the first byte first.
41 * Bits are read within a byte from most-significant to least-significant bit.
42 * IMPORTANT: Bit source DOES NOT copy data byte, thus make sure that the bytes outlive the bit source object.
43 */
44 explicit BitSource(const ByteArray& bytes) : _bytes(bytes) {}
45
46 BitSource(BitSource &) = delete;
47 BitSource& operator=(const BitSource &) = delete;
48
49 /**
50 * @return index of next bit in current byte which would be read by the next call to {@link #readBits(int)}.
51 */
52 int bitOffset() const {
53 return _bitOffset;
54 }
55
56 /**
57 * @return index of next byte in input byte array which would be read by the next call to {@link #readBits(int)}.
58 */
59 int byteOffset() const {
60 return _byteOffset;
61 }
62
63 /**
64 * @param numBits number of bits to read
65 * @return int representing the bits read. The bits will appear as the least-significant
66 * bits of the int
67 * @throws IllegalArgumentException if numBits isn't in [1,32] or more than is available
68 */
69 int readBits(int numBits);
70
71 /**
72 * @return number of bits that can be read successfully
73 */
74 int available() const;
75};
76
77} // ZXing
78
